ab.title: Leviticus 27
ab.l: And the Lord spoke to Moses,saying,
‘Speak to the children of Israel, and sayto them, “When a man will separate a special vow by your valuation of persons for the Lord,
Then your valuation shall be: A male from twenty years old even up to sixty years old:your valuation shall be fifty mithqals of silver, by the mithqalof the Holy.
And if it is a female, then your valuation shall bethirty mithqals.
And if it is from five years |old| even up to twenty years |old|,then your valuation shall be: |for| a male twenty mithqals, and for a femaleten mithqals.
And if it is from a month old up to five years |old|,then your valuation shall be |for| the male five mithqals of silver and for a femalethree mithqals of silver.
And if it is from sixty years oldand above: if it is a male, then your valuation shall be fifteenmithqals, and for the female ten mithqals.

But if he is poorerthan your valuation, then one shall stand him before the priest, andthe priest shall value him. According to what the power of the handof the one that vowed can attain shall the priest value him.
And ifit is such an animal from which offering is brought forward to the Lord, allthat is given of it to the Lord shall be holy.
He shall not exchange it orchange it, good for bad or bad for good.And if he shall at all exchange animal for animal, thenit and the one exchanged shall be holy.
And ifit is any unclean animal from which sacrifice is not brought forward to the Lord,then one shall stand the animal before the priest.
And the priest shall value it, between good andbad: according to your valuation, oh priest, so shall it be.
Andif its owner will at all redeem it, then he shall add a fifthpart of it to your valuation.
And a man whoconsecrates his house |to be| holy to the Lord, then the priest shall value it,between good and bad: as the priest values,it so shall it stand.
And if the one who consecratesit redeems his own house, then he shall add the fifth part of the silverof your valuation to it, and it shall be his.
And ifa man hallows to the Lord some part of a field of his possession,then your valuation shall be according to its seed: the sown seed ofa homer of barley for fifty mithqals of silver.
Ifhe consecrates his field from the year of jubilee, it shall stand, oh priest, according to your valuation.

But if he consecrateshis field after the jubilee, then the priest shall calculatethe silver for him according to the years that remain,until the year of the jubilee, and it shall be reduced from your valuation.
Andif the one who consecrates the field will indeed redeem it,then he shall add the fifth part of the silver of your valuationto it, and it shall stand as his.
And ifhe does not redeem the field, and if he sells the fieldto another man, it shall not be redeemed anymore.
Andwhen the field goes out in the jubilee, it |shall be| holy to the Lord, like a devoted field;his possession shall be the priest’s.
Andif a man hallows a field which he has bought, that is not from the fieldsof his possession, to the Lord,
Thenthe priest shall calculate for him the amount of your valuation, up to the year of the jubilee,and he shall give your valuation in that day, a holy |thing| to the Lord.
In the year of the jubilee the field shall return to him from whom it was bought,to whom the possession of the land belongs.
Andall your valuations shall be by the mithqal of the Holy: twenty gög shall bethe mithqal.
Just: the firstborn of the animals: if a firstborn is born to the Lordno man shall consecrate it. Whether an ox, or sheep:it is the Lord’s.

And if a firstborn is bornto an unclean animal, then he shall redeem it according to your valuation, and shall adda fifth part to it. And if it is not redeemed, then,oh priest, it shall be sold according to your valuation.

Just: any devoted thingthat a man shall devote to the Lord of all that he has — from humanor animal or from a field of his possession — shall not be soldnor redeemed: every devoted thing is a holy of holies to the Lord.
Anyone devoted who is devoted from humans shall not be redeemed.He shall surely be put to death.
And all the tithe of the land, from of the seedof the land, from the fruit of the tree: to is the Lord’s. It is holyto the Lord.
And if a man will at all redeemany of his tithes, he shall add to it the fifth part of it.
And all the tithe of the cattle or of the flock, everything thatpasses under the rod, the tenth shall be holy to the Lord.
He shall not inspect whether it be good or bad. And he shall not exchangeit: and if he exchanges it at all, then both it and the one exchangedfor it shall be holy. It shall not be redeemed.”’

These are the commandmentswhich the Lord commanded Moses to teach to the children of Israel.And the Lord commanded these commandments to Moses on Mount Sinai.And praise be to the great and awesome God with whom light dwells, and with his help –may He be blessed whose name is He Who Dwells Between the Cherubim – the peshatim of the Book of Leviticus are completed.In the name of Him who gives rest to wanderers and vagabonds and strengthens the hand of the poorand seats them in His only home I will start to write the peshat of the book of Pentateuch – of the Book of Numbers.The day of birth of my beloved young son Zecharia: the 6th day of the parashat Ki Tavo, the 22nd of the month Elul|of the| year 549 by the abbreviated counting, may God let him grow up for the Torah, for the commandments and for good deeds. Amen, and may it be God’s will!The day of birth of my beloved daughter, the young girl Malka , the 5th day of the parashat Nitzavim, the 26th of the monthElul |of the| year 552 by the abbreviated counting.The day of birth of my beloved daughter, the young girl Esther , the 7th day of the parashatShoftim, the 7th of the month Elul |of the| year 555 by the abbreviated counting.
